rComments: Although the lectures were enjoyable enough, the content covered in class did not always match up with the reading, making writing exams quite difficult. Overall, he was a good professor and pretty good at teaching but the amount of reading and writing in this course was overwhelming.
not a bird course
He subjectively marks assignments and tests however he feels. Even if you hit all the points in a short answer you'll only get a 80. Standards are WAY too high for an A level course.

he's a really good professor and often times makes a couple jokes during his lectures since sometimes they can be a little boring. Easy marker and the assignments are straight forward and he is also always willing to help his students.  A lot of reading though which typically consists of a dozen pages or so. Attending his lectures help a lot too.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'EXTRA CREDIT', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: He will do as much as he can in order to help students pass, Although there are no tutorials in this course, it is more focused on to the readings of the text book. He understands that the readings are alot to take in so he will simplify the readings, (you will understand unless you did the readings) fairly easy class though
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: He's really nice, and will almost always push back assignment due dates! He doesn't like it when people don't attend class. Assignments take forever to get marked, there are a lot of readings and the assignments themselves are all based on complex readings. If you're not a great writer, I suggest you take another course. Def gotta work for the 4.0!
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Incredible prof, definitely the best I've had so far! The course has LectureCast - attendance is not mandatory & videos go up within the day. He ensures that the lectures are interactive and comfortable for everyone. Thorough syllabus, detailed outlines for midterm & final + assignments are clear & fair. Definitely recommend him, he's a great prof!

By far the best prof I've had so far! Though he requires us to show up at his lectures, they weren't boring and he tries to make the lecture feel really homey if you know what I mean. We even had a pizza party in the lecture at the end of the course which he paid for! Clear guidelines for assignments, and final ! Would love to be his student again!

Contrary to some of the opinions below about Professor Perley- he is one of the most outstanding Professors at UTSC. He is always  there to help students and does his best to ensure you succeed if you make the effort to do so.  For midterms and final exams, he tells you what is going to be on the exam and its a matter of knowing it all.
Pretty friendly prof! Very clear, easy if you do the assignment and memorize and can explain main points he discusses in class. Would recommend for GPA booster :D

I know a lot of people didn't like him, but for some reason, I did. It's good he encourages people to get in the habit of going to class, as opposed to sitting at home watching online; you miss out on the social aspect of going to school and meeting new friends. He's a fair teacher, just do what he assigns, keep up with the readings and you're set!

I took RLGA02, RLGC13, RLGB10 and this with him and he is so so HELPFUL! He is very passionate about the study of religion and goes out of his to help you feel interested as he is. In the upper year classes you will pizza party at the end. His marking is reasonable, no one complains about his grades, ever! He honestly is a creative & kind teacher.
Awesome professor, can teach the most of written and oral tradition.

He is an AMAZING professor. I took his course over the summer and I think by far he is the best professor I have ever met. Just do all your readings and attend his lectures. You will ace his course. He gives a lot of opportunities to students. Absolutely loved him

He's still remains to be one of my most favourite professors at UTSC. All of my electives I spent taking his courses. Warning however, this is not a bird course and you will have to put some work in, but the work is not hard.
HOORRRILE prof! unfair.

Great class; it's really not hard at all to do well; just go to lectures and take notes and pay attention! He even lets you resubmit the paper for a second time after receiving a mark for the first time! Very interesting class and I definitely learnt a lot!!!

Had him for rlga01, rlga02, rlgb10, rlgc05, rlgc13! and i must say he is a phenomenal professor! Very dedicated to teaching religion, like class participation, exams are fair, and he explains the concepts very clearly. Way better prof then Shiu that's for sure!

Prof is nice; class is pretty hard though - the marking is TOUGH. Textbook is not really needed (only used a few times to look up definitions for the quizzes). If you're looking for an easy elective, I wouldn't recommend this class. There is a good chance that this class will bring down your average, don't believe me...take the class!!
Pretty decent professor. Knows his material quite well. He is quite unorganized. He tends to give free marks as everything at the end does not go as on syllabus. Overall, pretty good. Nice man.
